title: use proc_macro test occurred

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust #[macro_use] extern crate helper; pub trait A { fn println() { println!("hello from A"); } } struct A1 {} impl A1 { fn new() -> Self { Self { } } } #[derive(Debug)] #[derive_attribute(A1)] pub struct PluginSettings {} pub trait Plugin { fn get(&self) -> Self; } pub trait PluginSet { fn load(&self, input: T) -> T; } #[cfg(test)] mod tests { // use super::*; #[test] fn it_works() { // let a = A {}; } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` ``` ### Error output ``` ☁ gatecross [master] ⚡ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo build Compiling time v0.3.11 warning: struct `A1` is never constructed --> plugin/src/lib.rs:10:8 | 10 | struct A1 {} | ^^ | = note: `#[warn(dead_code)]` on by default warning: associated function `new` is never used --> plugin/src/lib.rs:13:8 | 13 | fn new() -> Self { Self { } } | ^^^ warning: `plugin` (lib) generated 2 warnings thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 1 but the index is 2', compiler/rustc_builtin_macros/src/format.rs:1001:28 stack backtrace: 0: ___udivti3 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt 2: core::panicking::panic_bounds_check 3: rustc_builtin_macros::format::expand_preparsed_format_args 4: rustc_builtin_macros::format::expand_format_args_impl 5: ::fully_expand_fragment 6: ::expand_crate 7: ::time::, rustc_interface::passes::configure_and_expand::{closure#1}> 8: rustc_interface::passes::configure_and_expand 9: ::expansion 10: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> 11: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#1}> 12: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}> 13: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.64.0-nightly (c2f428d2f 2022-07-14) running on aarch64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `time` ```
Backtrace

``` ```
